alert.note: Alert for Brown (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 27 at 7:19PM CDT until March 30 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following county, Brown. * WHEN...Until 845 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 718 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms...from Lake Brownwood east to Owens. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Brownwood, Blanket, Lake Brownwood State Park, Lake Brownwood, Lake Brownwood Near Thrifty, Owens and Thrifty. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... FM 1467 crossing Blanket Creek, FM 2273 crossing Rough Branch, CR 321 crossing Blanket Creek Branch and County Road 362 crossing Blanket Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
